thread.title: Martin McGuinness to resign as Northern Ireland deputy first minister
thread.title_full: Martin McGuinness to resign as Northern Ireland deputy first minister

author: Henry McDonald
title: Martin McGuinness to resign as Northern Ireland deputy first minister

persons.name: jeff spicer/pa martin mcguinness martin mcguinness

text:
Martin McGuinness Martin McGuinness to resign as Northern Ireland deputy first minister 
Sinn Féin says McGuinness standing down in protest against Democratic Unionist party handling of a renewable energy scheme The deputy first minister of Northern Ireland, Martin McGuinness. Photograph: Jeff Spicer/PA Martin McGuinness Martin McGuinness to resign as Northern Ireland deputy first minister 
Sinn Féin says McGuinness standing down in protest against Democratic Unionist party handling of a renewable energy scheme   15.15 GMT Last modified on   15.22   
Martin McGuinness is to resign at 5pm on Monday as deputy first minister of the Northern Ireland executive in protest against the Democratic Unionist party’s handling of a botched renewable energy scheme, Sinn Féin has said. 
In a letter to the speaker of the Northern Ireland assembly, McGuinness said Arlene Foster’s decision not to stand aside over the affair was “not credible or tenable”. He added that Sinn Féin would not nominate a replacement and that there should now be an election. 
More details soon …
